etymologies: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek sunōnumon, neuter (used as a noun) of the adjective sunōnumos, from sun- ‘with’ + onoma ‘name’

definitions: a word or phrase that means exactly or nearly the same as another word or phrase in the same language, for example shut is a synonym of close

examples.text: “the East” was a synonym for the Soviet empire

shortDefinitions: word or phrase that means same as another word or phrase in same language

definitions: a person or thing so closely associated with a particular quality or idea that the mention of their name calls it to mind

examples.text: the Victorian age is a synonym for sexual puritanism

shortDefinitions: person or thing so closely associated with particular quality or idea that mention of their name calls it to mind

definitions: a taxonomic name which has the same application as another, especially one which has been superseded and is no longer valid.
shortDefinitions: taxonomic name which has same application as another
